channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Tesla shares fall 8% in premarket trading after earnings miss
item.description: Tesla shares fell more in premarket trading in the U.S. after it reported second-quarter earnings that missed expectations.

item.title: World shatters heat record for the second time in just two days
item.description: The world registered its hottest day on record for the second time in just two days, according to the latest data compiled by the EU's climate monitor.

item.title: Deutsche Bank shares drop 6% after lender snaps 15-quarter profit streak
item.description: Net loss attributable to shareholders was 143 million euros ($155.1 million), against an LSEG poll of analysts which had predicted a loss of 145 million euros.

item.title: World's largest luxury group LVMH slumps 4% after second-quarter revenue miss
item.description: Shares in LVMH fell on Wednesday after the luxury group on Tuesday released its earnings for the first half of 2024.

item.title: Trump 2.0 could go 'nuclear' on China trade, while economists say Harris would remain tough
item.description: Economists and trade experts largely expect Trump would further cut and destabilize trade relations between the world's two largest economies.

item.title: Spain's Santander posts 20% hike in net profit as retail business shines
item.description: Banco Santander posted a 20% year-on-year hike in second-quarter net profit underpinned by growth in its retail, wealth and consumer activity.

item.title: India 'clearly has a problem' finding new drivers for economic growth, JPMorgan's Jahangir Aziz says
item.description: India "clearly has a problem" figuring out new drivers for its economic growth even as its economy expands at a fast pace, JPMorgan said.

item.title: An Asian city is named the safest destination in the world for travelers
item.description: Singapore is named the world's safest city for tourists, according to recent research by Forbes Advisor.

item.title: How the ultra-wealthy travel in Paris
item.description: CNBC Travel's First Class explores the top places to stay, eat and spend your time in Paris —with an unlimited budget.

item.title: What Google's decision to keep cookies means for the internet
item.description: CNBC runs through what cookies are, and how Google's decision to keep them will affect the internet and advertising industry moving forward.

item.title: Major global chip equipment makers' China revenue share has doubled since U.S. imposed export controls
item.description: Four of the world's largest chip equipment manufacturers have more than doubled the share of their China revenue since late 2022, Bank of America analysts said.

item.title: Chinese EV stocks drop as Tesla's earnings miss, General Motors delays EV plans
item.description: Shares of China's electric vehicle companies mostly dropped on Wednesday after U.S. giant Tesla's earnings fell short of analyst estimates.

item.title: Europe's AI-powered Google Translate rival DeepL launches traditional Chinese language in Asia push
item.description: DeepL, one of Europe's high-profile AI companies valued at $2 billion, sells translation software aimed at businesses.

item.title: Elon Musk says he expects China to approve Tesla's Full Self-Driving by the end of the year
item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has again touted the impending rollout of advanced driver-assist software in China, after reporting disappointing earnings.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Nasdaq futures fall as Alphabet, Tesla earnings disappoint
item.description: Wall Street slips ahead of megacap earnings. Alphabet's Youtube ad revenue misses expectations. Tesla slides on weaker-than-expected earnings

item.title: Tesla's profit margin is getting hammered by EV discounts and hefty AI spending
item.description: Tesla's adjusted operating margin shrank to its lowest in three years in the second quarter, contributing to a plunge in the stock price.

item.title: Podcast: How CrowdStrike caused a global IT meltdown and what comes next
item.description: In the latest episode of CNBC Tech's "Beyond the Valley" podcast, Arjun Kharpal and Tom Chitty discuss the CrowdStrike IT failure.

item.title: Alphabet meets earnings expectations but misses on YouTube ad revenue
item.description: Google parent company Alphabet reported earnings after the bell.

item.title: Elon Musk wants Tesla to invest $5 billion into his newest startup, xAI — if shareholders approve
item.description: During the Tuesday earnings call, shareholders asked Musk whether Tesla might invest in xAI and integrate xAI's software, named Grok, into its vehicles.

item.title: World logs hottest day since records began — with fresh highs expected in the coming months
item.description: The world's average temperature on Sunday climbed to its highest level ever recorded, according to the European Union's climate monitor.

item.title: Tesla reports 7% drop in auto revenue as earnings fall short of Wall Street estimates
item.description: Tesla reported a 7% decline in year-over-year automotive revenue for the second quarter, contributing to a drop in profit.

item.title: Modi's government pledges fiscal prudence in India's post-election budget
item.description: India's government promised spending on job creation but also called for fiscal prudence as it announced its financial budget on Tuesday.

item.title: GM shares sink 6% despite second-quarter beat as Wall Street fears 'good times won't last'
item.description: GM's North American operations, driven by truck sales, were largely responsible for the company's second-quarter beat and guidance raise.

item.title: French aerospace company sees surge in U.S. applicants after SpaceX relocation news: 'Come to Europe and we'll help you'
item.description: A French aerospace company is getting a surge of American applicants after Elon Musk said he would relocate SpaceX headquarters from California to Texas.

item.title: Novo Nordisk's Wegovy weight loss drug wins UK approval for use as a heart treatment
item.description: The U.K.'s health regulator on Tuesday approved the use of Novo Nordisk's Wegovy drug to reduce the risk of obese adults suffering from serious heart problems or strokes.

item.title: Farnborough Air Show kicks off with $51 billion in deals as Airbus shows off new ultra long-haul jet
item.description: Airbus flew the A321XLR for the first time since it was certified, but its U.S. rival, Boeing. dominated on the deal-making front.

item.title: Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle resigns over Trump shooting outrage
item.description: Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle was criticized for her agency's failure to prevent the attempted assassination of Donald Trump at a campaign rally.

item.title: Hungary told it can't host EU gathering after the latest clash with Putin ally over Ukraine
item.description: Hungary has been stripped of the right to host the next high-profile gathering of EU foreign ministers, marking the latest clash between the bloc and Budapest.

item.title: Scientists discover ‘dark oxygen’ being produced by seabed metals in ground-breaking study
item.description: A team of scientists has discovered that oxygen is being produced by metallic nodules thousands of meters below the surface of the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: GM slows its EV plans again even as sales grow
item.description: GM is again slowing its plans for all-electric vehicles by further delaying a second electric U.S. truck plant and the Buick brand's first EV.
